comments.body: Given that it’s here as well, I assume it is intentional.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@      set -euo pipefail

      if header=$(git config 'http.https://github.com/digital-asset/daml.extraheader'); then
          AUTH="$header"
      else

comments.body:
Perhaps put quotes around `$(branch)` so that if it doesn't show up, we get a more meaningful error message?

```suggestion
      az pipelines build queue --branch "$(branch)" --definition-name "digital-asset.daml" --org "https://dev.azure.com/digitalasset" --project daml
```

I want to see an error message along the lines of `invalid branch: ''`, not `could not parse the argument 'digital-asset.daml'`.

      echo "$(System.AccessToken)" | az devops login --org "https://dev.azure.com/digitalasset"
      az pipelines build queue --branch $(branch) --definition-name "digital-asset.daml" --org "https://dev.azure.com/digitalasset" --project daml

comments.body: It looks like we need a new pipeline for this. At the moment it doesn’t seem to get triggered from anywhere.
